partintro.simpara: The mail function allows you to send mail

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: Mail automatically mails the message specified in message to the receiver specified in to. Multiple recipients can be specified by putting a comma between each address in to.
refsect1.para: mail returns TRUE if the mail is sucessfully sent, FALSE otherwise.
refsect1.simpara: If a fourth string argument is passed, this string is inserted at the end of the header. This is typically used to add extra headers. Multiple extra headers are separated with a newline.

note.para: On Win32 systems, you must use \r\n to seperate headers. Please also note that the cc: and bcc: headers are case sensitve and should be written as Cc: and Bcc: on Win32 systems.

refsect1.simpara: If the fifth parameter is supplied, PHP will add this data to the call to the mailer. This is useful when setting the correct Return-Path header when using sendmail.

note.para: This fifth parameter was added in PHP 4.0.5.
Make sure you have no new-line (or other whitespace) after your to or subject parameters, as this may cause strange results.

refnamediv.refpurpose: Calculate the hash value needed by EZMLM

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.simpara: ezmlm_hash calculates the hash value needed when keeping EZMLM mailing lists in a MySQL database.
